Name: By Sun's Burning Hand
QuestDesc: As the High Tide draws near, a lurking calamity stirs, with its gaze fixed upon the borders of Septimont. Ephor Augusta invites you to the Sanguis Plateaus for a fateful hunt, the one that may decide the realm's survival...

Unlock.Name: Dream of A Rusted Sword: Part I

Chapters.Title: Return to the Leonidas Hotel

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Woo-wee. Sure is a beautiful day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So any news from the Ephor, {PlayerName}? Or are we still chillin' like we've been for the past few days?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ephor's Palace Attendant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good day, {Male=Sir;Female=Madam} {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ephor's Palace Attendant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am Damian, an attendant in service to the Ephor's Palace. By direct command, I have come to deliver you Her Excellency's personal letter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ephor's Palace Attendant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It concerns a matter of utmost importance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me and my big mouth...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, what does it say? Scooch up a bit.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It says Augusta has taken care of everything on her end. She's ready to meet us at the Ephor's Palace as agreed.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's most likely something to do with the <te href=750001>hunt</te>.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We shouldn't keep the Ephor waiting... Time to go, Abby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aww. You mean now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, I think I'll sit this one out and leave all the heavy stuff to you guys. Hehe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chat for as long as you like. Just gimme me a holler if you need me.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Ephor's Palace is just ahead.

Chapters.Title: Head to the Ephor's Palace

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like Augusta's already taken care of everything... Let's do this.

Chapters.Title: Head to the Ephor's Palace
Look for Augusta

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You're invited to the Ephor's Palace to meet Septimont's Ephor, Augusta. After an exchange of swords, she shares a brief history of Septimont's hunting traditions and formally invites you to join the hunt for the Dark Tide and its creations in the Sanguis Plateaus.

You accept and share information about the Sentinel's Relic and the Journeying Paradise. Upon hearing this, Augusta suggests that the Earthrend Wedge in the hunting grounds may be where the Relic is hidden. Before parting, she tells you that a storm rising in the skies southeast of Septimont will mark the beginning of the hunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Impressive!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I expected a challenge, but your performance far exceeds what I had imagined.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just as I thought, watching from the Colosseum's balcony is no way to understand a warrior's true spirit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only by crossing blades can I feel the will to fight pulsing through your veins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come. Step closer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Laureate of Ragunna. Champion of Septimont. Favored Gladiator of <ano=Lioness of Glory>Arsinosa</ano>—by the honor of these titles, it is only right you stand by my side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I, Augusta, Ephor of Septimont, offer you my highest esteem.

Options.PlotLineKey: You've got a unique way of greeting guests.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe. Simple and efficient, no need for pleasantries. Here, we let our blades do the talking. The Septimont way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have no doubt that you and I will have plenty of opportunities to get acquainted. But that's not why I called you here today...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On my behalf, and that of the Ephor's Palace, I extend my deepest apologies for failing to keep our appointment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hope this delay hasn't dampened your enthusiasm for the hunt.

Options.PlotLineKey: It was urgent. No need to apologize.
Your hospitality very much made up for it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha. Tolerant and strong. Just as I've heard. Virtues of a true hero.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, then. Seeing that your interest still holds. Shall we discuss it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The hunt—in Septimont's long fight for survival, it holds profound significance...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is both honor and duty. For a hundred years, countless Gladiators have taken up the hunt and met their end in glory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's no exaggeration to say that the blood of Gladiators still burns in every inch of the crimson Sanguis Plateaus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our ancestors built the defenses that line those grounds. To this day, they stand as the frontline of Septimont's resistance against the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've surely noticed the lingering Blightcloud that hovers over the Sanguis Plateaus. Since the first Dark Tide outbreak in Rinascita, that place has become a breeding ground for its <te href=750002>horrors</te>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you've no doubt realized, our prey are Tacet Discords born from the Dark Tide. Only those who desecrate Septimont fall beneath the Gladiators' blades.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The High Tide is upon us... and it will be a storm like no other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My hunting party requires unstoppable warriors. Sacrifices are inevitable, but I believe you will be a banner that stands unbroken, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: There are plenty of great Gladiators in Septimont...
What made you want to invite me on this hunt?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I share your sentiment. Septimont takes pride in its many remarkable Gladiators. But you, you are exceptional.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A grand hunt awaits us, and my warriors and I long to do battle alongside a fighter such as yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, the will of the extraordinary deserves to be heard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd like to know your thoughts on the matter, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: I agree to join your hunt, but I have my own goal to accomplish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A straightforward answer. I like it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for this "goal" of yours...

Options.PlotLineKey: (Share what you've learned about the Sentinel's Relic and the Journeying Paradise.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, yes, the Journeying Paradise. I've heard that laughable name before. A pity the hunt was made to shatter that little fantasy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the Sentinel's Relic...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go to the <te href=750003>Earthrend Wedge</te>. It's where the Sentinel Imperator first descended upon the Sanguis Plateaus and is the "epicenter" of every hunt to this day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, due to its significance, not even Septimont's highest officials are permitted near it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if that is what you wish... say no more. I will make it happen.

Options.PlotLineKey: You have great trust in me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The trust I place in you stems from your recognition of my character. I admire your honesty, and I will honor it to the fullest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only those bound by trust can go the distance together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I look forward to the hunt ahead. It honors me to journey by your side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Patience, my friend, is the first step to becoming a hunter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the storm rages in the skies southeast of Septimont, I will await you at <te href=750004>Tempest Cliffs</te>.

Chapters.Title: Leave the Ephor's Palace and wait for the hunt

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hic. I can't eat another bite... Hehe. That's another full stomach for Abby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Hey, {PlayerName}. Look! Over there!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's... a storm...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which means it's about time to meet up with Augusta.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tempest Cliffs. I remember that's where she told us to go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh... Well... You better hurry!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Same as always, call me when you need me and I'll be out in a flash!

Chapters.Title: Head to Tempest Cliffs

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seeing a storm form in the distance, you head for Tempest Cliffs, the agreed-upon meeting point. Along the way, you encounter the Gladiator Avidius, who's also bound for the hunt. He suggests traveling together.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This... should be the right way...
If you're heading for Tempest Cliffs, head east. This path will take you straight to the courtyard of glory.
Or perhaps, would you care to travel with me?
After all, we share the same destination. Your reputation precedes you, honorable {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am Gladiator Avidius. At your service.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you also here for the hunt?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Gladiating" and "hunting" are the very pillars upon which the glory of Septimont stands. I believe no Gladiator would refuse such an honor if invited.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I, of course, am no exception.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, if you'll follow me. Honored guest from afar.

Chapters.Title: Follow Avidius to Tempest Cliffs

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta spoke of the great surge we are about to face.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Ephor speaks the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... this year's High Tide has come later than usual, which bodes ill.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a shame even the sharp ears of the Senate could not chisel through the high walls of Tetragon Temple, to hear the whispers beyond...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, is this an auspice of calamity, or a prelude to a new legend? Only time will tell...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Under Avidius's escort, you arrive at Tempest Cliffs. Once the hunting party is assembled, Augusta gives the order to begin the campaign.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The pleasure of escorting you to the Ephor has been fulfilled. For now, my duty ends here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From here, we march onward to the hunting grounds, where the Dark Tide's creations may await us. When the time comes, it will be a true pleasure to see your skills in action.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Happy hunting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come. Join us, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The horns signal our departure.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do we set out from Tempest Cliffs?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Precisely. These cliffs mark the opening of our campaign.

Options.PlotLineKey: But there's no bridge to the other side.
Wait... Are we using our gliders?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha! Take courage, my friend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The path to glory will reveal itself under the feet of the brave.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that...?

Chapters.Title: Defeat the Corrosaurus
Defeat the Corrosaurus

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph. Getting restless, are we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That is a Corrosaurus. An abomination of the Dark Tide...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do exercise caution, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now is not the moment

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let it flee. The path it takes leads deeper into the trap we laid

Chapters.Title: Follow Augusta and Iuno to the Hunter's Den

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That sound...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's from Hornett. An Echo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's signaling we "retire" for the day, that's all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta, time to bring your party back to the Hunter's Den.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, Priestess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your arrow couldn't have come at a better time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph. Seeing that {PlayerName} is here, I'll take that as a compliment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The hunting party stops at the Hunter's Den to rest and resupply. There, you meet Iuno, a Priestess of Tetragon Temple whose combat skills rival those of any Gladiator.

Augusta reveals that the beast that attacked earlier is a Corrosaurus known as "Tyrannos," one of the Dark Tide's more fearsome creations and the target of this hunt. She explains that only by slaying it within the Earthrend Wedge's range can its frequency be bound, stopping the Dark Tide's advance.

As Augusta steps away to plan the next phase of the hunt, the dreaded Whispers stir in her ears.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Hunter's Den. The busiest Gladiator encampment across the Sanguis Plateaus. Nearly every hunter passes through here on their way to the hunting grounds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We will rest here before setting off for the next hunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I must admit, this place is rather magnificent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suppose my predecessors forsook the peace they ought to have enjoyed, just to share this hard-earned land with these hunters. Such magnificence is rightly owed to the <te href=750005>Temple</te>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, the Priestess's words are not without merit. I am well aware that I stand under blessings, and will forever remember the sacrifices of the Temple.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now if you'll excuse me. I'll be taking my leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tch...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though we've already met, I suppose a proper introduction is in order.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am Iuno. Priestess of the Tetragon Temple.

Options.PlotLineKey: I've heard about you. The Priestesses get to call the shots.
I've heard about you. The Priestesses have the gift of prophecy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, aren't you caught up on things? What you say is true, though I've long since grown tired of such affairs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come now, {PlayerName}. Surely you can find me something more interesting to occupy my time. For instance... the hunt?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Quite frankly, when it comes to dealing with the Dark Tide, none of these Gladiators can hold a candle to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha. Look at those looks. I've seen them all before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What can I say? When you're as dazzling as I am, jealousy tends to follow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll be making my way back, Augusta. Lest my shine further sting the eyes of certain people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you find yourself with free time later, consider visiting me at Tetragon Temple.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not every outlander is granted access to its sacred halls. Make the most of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's rare to see Iuno hold back like that. You must be someone... different to her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps... We do share some common traits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe. Don't let her unruly side fool you. She is as dependable as they come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Corrosaurus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Avidius was correct. It is a Tacet Discord born from the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What he didn't have the chance to tell you is that it is the deadliest Corrosaurus of them all—we call it "Tyrannos." A vanguard of the Dark Tide that rides its surge to reach our lands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian's attempt to plague Septimont never came to fruition. But do not mistake that for victory. Our enemy will not bow so easily.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide, immortal and indestructible, carries out the will of its creator—the Threnodian Leviathan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only the Earthrend Wedge that bears Sentinel Imperator's power can sever the link between the Dark Tide and the Threnodian, burying the calamity deep beneath the Sanguis Plateaus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The "hunt" is how we disrupt the Dark Tide's frequencies by capturing and eliminating its creatures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, the Earthrend Wedge's energy range is limited. Our mission is to deliver a true death to our prey.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meaning we need to hunt and kill the beast near the Earthrender... Is that how we stop the Dark Tide from spreading?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. And it must be done within <te href=750006>Maroonwood</te>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This confrontation with Tyrannos was expected, but it's not a fight anyone is eager to face...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That beast is well aware of our plan. It's no mere prey. In many ways, it's a cunning hunter itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now we wait. We wait for it to enter Maroonwood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The real hunt begins when the beast's hunger drives it to the wilds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ephor's Palace Attendant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your Excellency, the Senators request your presence in the main tent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ephor's Palace Attendant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's to discuss plans for the hunting operation...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like I'll be occupied for a while.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Relax. Take a walk around camp. The <te href=750007>Hornett</te>'s blare will sound our next departure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a sound that can be heard across the <te href=750008>canyons</te>. You won't miss it.

Chapters.Title: Listen in on the Gladiators' conversation

Dialogues.Speaker: Cileli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you hear? About Avidius and the Senate...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brandis
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A power struggle. Nothing new. But going up against Augusta is a steep hill to climb.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cileli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Without a strong Forte, Augusta's strength was always going to have limits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cileli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She lacks the "extraordinary power" mentioned in the prophecies. Hard to compare her with the Heroes of Heroes of the past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brandis
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wouldn't put it like that. Knowing how Augusta operates, Avidius wouldn't have even risen to prominence if she hadn't allowed it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brandis
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That kind of grace... is the mark of a real ruler.

Dialogues.Speaker: Torro
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A High Tide of unprecedented scale...

Dialogues.Speaker: Torro
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could this be the one in the prophecy... the harbinger of Septimont's doom?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hercle
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A High Tide is a High Tide. Every hunt is a gamble with our lives, no matter the size.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hercle
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just keep your blade sharp. Whatever comes, we cut it down. Don't overthink it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorreno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strange that Augusta would allow Avidius to join the hunt… without taking any precautions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorreno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've certainly invested a lot into this, Lord Falco.

Dialogues.Speaker: Falco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our Ephor desires competition. I'm simply granting her wish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Falco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As to whether she keeps her throne… well, sometimes the brightest stars burn out fastest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Malenta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Avidius has been making waves recently…

Dialogues.Speaker: Malenta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are whispers from the Senate that he might actually be the one to fulfill the Hero of Heroes prophecy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Licastro
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A scion of Atilius, plus four expeditions to Manes Deep… Can't deny his Resonance ability fits the prophecy perfectly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Licastro
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The victor is still uncertain. We'll see soon enough.

Chapters.Title: Ride the Wingray

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno mentioned visiting her at Tetragon Temple... Got a bit of free time. Might as well pay her a visit.

Chapters.Title: Enter Tetragon Temple

Dialogues.Speaker: Zela
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This hunt…

Dialogues.Speaker: Zela
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see no clear future…

Dialogues.Speaker: Zela
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only shadows… I see only unsettling shadows behind the flames...

Dialogues.Speaker: Melina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Calm yourself. Let go of worries and fear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Melina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is your conflicting emotions that obscure the true face of destiny.

Dialogues.Speaker: Seraph
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I overheard a few Gladiators guessing who the next Hero of Heroes might be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Seraph
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't need the Sacred Flames' guidance to know the path to the throne is already shadowed by conflict.

Dialogues.Speaker: Naria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We still haven't seen the new Hero's face. No one knows who deserves to claim that title.

Dialogues.Speaker: Seraph
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That very uncertainty is why prophecy, once a beacon meant to guide the people, is now being twisted to serve the ambitions of a few.

Dialogues.Speaker: Seraph
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sometimes I wonder if prophecy truly illuminates the path forward... What if it's a chain trapping people in what they want to believe?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mars
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry about me, Leonora. Augusta commands this hunt, and Avidius rides with us. Victory is assured.

Dialogues.Speaker: Leonora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, this is your first time joining a hunt like this…

Dialogues.Speaker: Mars
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No Gladiator would deny themselves such an honor. We've trained all these years for this moment, haven't we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Leonora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wish I'd been chosen to go with you…

Dialogues.Speaker: Mars
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It'll be fine, Leonora. Bless me with your heart, and you'll be with me wherever I go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Leonora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll wait for you right here till you return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Leonora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mars…

Dialogues.Speaker: Leonora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forget the honor, just come back to me safe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Leonora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is all I can do now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Leonora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'll be out there with them, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Leonora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll be hoping for your safe return too.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't think I'd find something this grand way out here in the hunting grounds.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No sign of Iuno though...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are those... murals on the wall?

Chapters.Title: Examine the large mural

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A booklet lies before the murals, recording the faint inscriptions carved beneath them…

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Only the Hero of Heroes of extraordinary power, risen from the dark tides, shall bring eternity to Septimont."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Then shall the waters quiet, the tempest still, and glory return with the blood of the old king."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You notice the mural is incomplete, with a conspicuous patch in the center where the depiction is missing...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't fully understand what this means, but your intuition tells you its significance reaches far beyond the blank wall left behind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
With time to spare, you visit Tetragon Temple and meet Avidius and Iuno. Avidius discusses the prophetic murals: The ancient Ragunnesi predicted Septimont's downfall, but the Priestesses later prophesied that a Hero of Heroes would one day rise to save it.

Avidius and Iuno clash over the prophecy. You learn that, in the Senate's eyes, Avidius better embodies the qualities of this Hero than Augusta. But Augusta pays his ambitions no mind. If anything, she welcomes any challenge from a worthy opponent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good day to you, {Male=Sir;Female=Madam} {PlayerName}. It seems you too have taken an interest in the Temple's murals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They are the works of past Priestesses. They depict prophecies glimpsed in the <te href=750009>Sacred Flames</te>—ones already fulfilled and ones yet to come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In any case, all these murals point to two prophecies of importance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The first is a Ragunnesi prophecy condemning Septimont's lack of faith in the Sentinel—

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Hear this, O faithless ones of Septimont. The Divinity of the high heavens has grown enraged. Should your monarch once more stand in contempt of Their will, annihilation shall be your fate."

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The second is a continuation of the Ragunnesi prophecy, delivered by Septimont's Priestesses—

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Only the Hero of Heroes of extraordinary power, risen from the dark tides, shall bring eternity to Septimont. Then shall the waters quiet, the tempest still, and glory return with the blood of the old king."

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You seem drawn to that particular mural... It tells of a calamity yet to come, and as always, the Hero of Heroes who shall rise among us to turn the tide of fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet the identity of this Hero remains a mystery. Coincidentally, much like the absent part of this mural, the prophecy of our victory over the coming disaster remains untold...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether the Priestesses can't foresee the fate that awaits, or whether the true prophecy is meant to remain hidden... Is indeed a question worth pondering.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our would-be Hero of Heroes, lost in daydreams again? What is it this time? Staring at an empty wall, hoping one day it'll bear your name?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I happened to wander by, passing the time as one does. No need to trouble yourself with someone as inconsequential as I, Priestess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Inconsequential? Come now. Everyone knows you're the Senate's golden child. Those old loons wouldn't spare me a glance, but they hang on your every word.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you been waiting long? Ugh, I can't believe he got to you first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Isn't paying respects to the Heroes fairly commonplace? Surely, we needn't allow rivalry to come between us, Priestess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph. I'm not blind to your tricks, Avidius. Do you really think {PlayerName} would take sides? With you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me guess... Eliminating Tyrannos and the Dark Tide before anyone else would be the perfect act to prove you're the prophesied Hero of Heroes, hmm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Four expeditions to <te href=750010>Manes Deep</te> plus a <te href=750011>Holmleaf Medal</te>, and now you think you can usurp Augusta's place? Don't make me laugh.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, read the room, will you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, I don't deny that I am ambitious and aspire to better my station. But I value my duty to defend Septimont's glory just as equally.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should I become the next Hero, Septimont would be spared when the next calamity arrives. Is this not what the Tetragon Temple has prophesized?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why you...

Options.PlotLineKey: What if Augusta is the true Hero of Heroes?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She possesses many qualities worthy of a Hero. But she lacks the "extraordinary power" mentioned in the prophecy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As a Resonator, Augusta offers nothing special. Yet throughout Septimont's history, every Hero of Heroes was born with extraordinary gifts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She may have the strength to wield a sword, but I doubt her ability to endure pain and the slow, wearisome passage of time like other Resonators.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a pity that in a city built on prophecy, Augusta is a disruptor of the rules.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I assure you, Priestess, I will not act from the shadows. If Augusta seeks a fair challenge, I shall honor her with the respect she deserves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Priestess, {PlayerName}, I beg your leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps... we will bear witness to the birth of a new Hero in the hunt to come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, there you have it. That's the gist of it. Ugh, finally some time together, and now it's all ruined...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't understand. Given Augusta's prestige, the Senate has no real advantage in seizing power. What's their angle?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It all started when Augusta shook things up the moment she became Ephor. Especially in rooting out corruption within the Gladiator's Agon while ignoring the senators in the process.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Naturally, it ruffled some feathers. Some even accused her of "undermining the spirit of Gladiating." In reality, they're just upset their piggy banks got smashed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More importantly...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is exactly the kind of chaos Augusta wanted. That idiot!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She even went so far as to say, "The citizens of Septimont only need to be loyal to Septimont, not her, Augusta."

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And then, like it's nothing, she tells me that the Ephor position only matters when a strong Gladiator wants it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's even more stubborn than I am.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you worried about Augusta's capabilities?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now why would I be worried about that? I'm sure you've seen her sword. The inlaid blades are trophies of every Gladiator she's defeated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even ones with decent Resonance powers like Avidius, she eats for breakfast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though... Avidius makes me rather uncomfortable. It's got nothing to do with his stance, it's... more of a hunch. Something about him feels... unnatural.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or maybe I'm just overthinking it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the <te href=750012>Griffrex</te>! It appears our prey has finally come out for some fresh air.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll meet again later. But next time, I'd like your undivided attention. No distractions, hmm?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that lady over there... looking at me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Better go and greet her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A booklet lies before the murals, recording the faint inscriptions carved beneath them…

Options.PlotLineKey: (Inspect the first mural on the upper left.)
(Inspect the second mural on the upper left.)
(Inspect the third mural on the upper left.)
(Inspect the massive mural at the bottom.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Fabius, the one who walked with Sentinel Imperator. Prophesied Hero of Heroes."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The untamable blackened tide surged, its sinewy arms outstretched. With hands steadfast as stone, Fabius led through the storm, ascending to the eternal highlands."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The victor's flag flutters in wild winds: From this day forth, the lands beneath my feet shall belong to Septimont."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "'The Monument' Atilius. Prophesied Hero of Heroes."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "An unyielding spirit. A valiant conqueror."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "When the black waters fell from the heavens, he was the ironclad dam that stood between Septimont and the calamity."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "'The Untarnished Blade' Valeria. Prophesied Hero of Heroes."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "She, sole monarch of the land of pursuit and huntsmanship."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Our noble queen shall raise blade and spear, slice the throats of beasts, and reclaim Septimont's eternal glory from the chokehold of the Dark Tide."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A blurred mural. It seems to mirror the one across from it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The murals do not fade. In the silence of time, they remain, waiting for your gaze.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A booklet lies before the murals, recording the faint inscriptions carved beneath them…

Options.PlotLineKey: (Inspect the first mural on the upper left.)
(Inspect the second mural on the upper left.)
(Inspect the third mural on the upper left.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An empty wall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It silently waits for the tides of fate to leave damp traces on its parched shore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Heed me, ████ of Septimont. The █ of the heavens has ████."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Should █████ be ██████ again. Then ██ be the fate that awaits Septimont."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An empty wall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It silently waits for the tides of fate to leave damp traces on its parched shore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The murals do not fade. In the silence of time, they remain, waiting for your gaze.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the lady holding a candelabra

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've been expecting you, roving hero.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Hmm... A void. An unknowable fate...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Worry not, my child. A void is by no means nothingness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Follow its guidance and let it lead. It will open the path to boundless possibility, guiding us through the fog to shores untouched by any before us...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The elderly Priestess does not respond. Her gaze is fixed on the blazing flames, her mind seemingly far away, lost in another realm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perfect timing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll stretch my legs a bit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wonder what Grandmother Lillibet and {PlayerName} are talking about...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Never mind. It can wait.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's get eyes on this beast, Aquila.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Spirits of the hallowed land. Answer my call.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May the eternal Sacred Flames grant us boundless sight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Griffrex's cry draws Iuno to the top of Tetragon Temple. Through the eyes of Aquila, her bonded Griffrex, she spots the Corrosaurus Tyrannos deep in Maroonwood. She launches an arrow to ignite the signal flare. The hunt is on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baptiste
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the best blade I've forged in a long while.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baptiste
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To face the Dark Tide creations, steel and soul must fight as one. Sadly, I've seen far more blades make it home than men…

Dialogues.Speaker: Baptiste
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hope this blade bring you luck, lad!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fredrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Does this sword have a name, sir?

Dialogues.Speaker: Baptiste
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, not yet. Tell me, lad, what's your name?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fredrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fredrico, sir.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baptiste
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fredrico… A fine name. Return with this blade, and you can name it after you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fredrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …I will earn that honor, sir.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fredrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For the glory of my House, I'll prove myself worthy of this sword.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baptiste
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You made it back, lad!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fredrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Barely… This hunt was beyond anything I imagined. Just staying alive took all I had. If it weren't for Ephor Augusta and the others...

Dialogues.Speaker: Baptiste
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Survival is an honor in itself. Don't be too hard on yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fredrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Also… the sword you gave me, I lost it in the battle…

Dialogues.Speaker: Fredrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Gladiator should never let go of their blade. I guess I'm not ready yet…

Dialogues.Speaker: Baptiste
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha! A sword's a sword. I can always forge another.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baptiste
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you, you are the real blade of Septimont. This hunt only whets your edge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baptiste
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shame, though. The sword with your name will have to wait for another day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fredrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until then, I'll keep sharpening myself.

Chapters.Title: Meet with Augusta

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the horn...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd better find Augusta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
At the sound of the horn, you regroup and set out for Rustblood Pass.
To lure Tyrannos into the Earthrend Wedge's range, Augusta has devised a strategy using Anchor Stones. But with traps already laid by Tyrannos, the hunting party decides it's safer to approach Maroonwood on foot.
Just before departure, Augusta hears the Whispers return with an ominous warning. The path ahead will not be easy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Behind that cliff is the Earthrend Wedge. A relic of Sentinel Imperator as ancient as these lands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The destination of your journey. My promise to you. Our shared goal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An <te href=750013>Anchor Stone</te> made from Tacetite formed around the Earthrender.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It contains a fraction of the Earthrender's power. It offers no defense capabilities, but it can at least serve as a temporary measure to hold off the Dark Tide or its creations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to deploy three of these in pre-determined locations across Maroonwood to generate a force field. This will drive the Corrosaurus to the <te href=750015>Asphodel Barrens</te> in the lower levels.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The field blooming with Asphodels is where the hunting party can safely reach the lower levels. Judging from the height, it's close to the Earthrender's base.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that field of glory, we will grant Tyrannos the death it deserves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tyrannos's calling card as the vanguard of the Dark Tide. Our prey isn't exactly known for playing by the rules.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maroonwood lies on the other side of these cliffs. That beast has reasoned we're likely to take to the skies on Griffrexes and has laid an ambush, waiting to drag us down into the abyss.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...A Corrosaurus that knows how to set a trap, waiting for its hunters to walk right into it... Heh. Quite an interesting opponent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gladiators, march with me to the hunting grounds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let the Sacred Flames ignite your resolve! The enemies of Septimont shall bear witness to our might!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It... awaits you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let us be on our way.

Chapters.Title: Cross through Rustblood Pass
Pursue Corrosaurus: Tyrannos
Head to Asphodel Barrens

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With all Anchor Stones in place, the hunting party tracks Tyrannos to Asphodel Barrens, a historical battlefield scarred by brutal conflicts between Gladiators and Dark Tide creations. Augusta, embracing her rivalry with fellow would-be Hero of Heroes Avidius, proposes they hunt the Corrosaurus together. The stakes are set for their eventual duel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A field of corpses. Horrifying, isn't it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is Tyrannos's birthplace. A kingdom of brutality, and the beast is proud of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every hunt before this... it was here that we met our final battles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Gladiators went to great lengths to drive the Dark Tide's creatures into the Asphodel Barrens. Likewise, their prey were just as eager to bait their hunters here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is destined to be an evenly matched game of life and death. Hunter or prey? Only the one still standing gets to decide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Avidius, descendant of the Hero of Heroes, Atilius. Decorated for the four crossings of Manes Deep.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see the desire in you. Your desire for power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet if you wish to be my opponent, then this level of resolve is far from enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Step forward. Stand next to me and pursue your desires without hesitation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let your ambitions burn even hotter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you wish, Your Excellency.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Finally, some fun for a change.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come. You need only to stay at my side, {PlayerName}. Rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is a matter between Augusta and Avidius. We shall not intervene for the time being.

Chapters.Title: Defeat Corrosaurus: Tyrannos

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything is in place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It will take the bait.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's our cue, {PlayerName}. We're going after it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All this effort we've put into setting this trap...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This "gift" of ours... it better take it, nice and obediently.

Chapters.Title: Pursue Corrosaurus: Tyrannos
Use Utility: Sensor to track down Tyrannos

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over there.

Chapters.Title: Follow Tyrannos's trail and press onward

Dialogues.Speaker: Tyrannos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *A piercing, agonized howl...*

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Main_Linaxita_2_9_605_1

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This way, {Male=Mr.;Female=Ms.} {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tyrannos's whereabouts… Heh, Aquila must have its eyes on it now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 2
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This one doesn't even worth a glance.

Chapters.Title: Head towards the cries

Dialogues.Speaker: Stunned Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-What was that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Steady... Now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The hunting party drives the wounded Tyrannos into the lower Asphodel Barrens. Suddenly, a shrieking cry echoes across the plateau. Augusta signals Iuno just as the Dark Tide surges, swallowing Tyrannos. Iuno draws her Moon Arrow aiming at a faint humanoid figure in the distance. You realize this mysterious entity was their true target all along.
Iuno... Iuno...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno and Augusta's hunt for the humanoid is thwarted by an unknown, powerful force. The Whispers tell Augusta that to end the Dark Tide, she must return to her hometown of Murmurstown. The hunting party decides to regroup and tend to the wounded at a nearby camp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What was that about? And that black fog... It was all mushy... I couldn't even finish it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hic. Oh boy, did I take a huge bite outta that one. My head's gone all swishy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... I need a quick timeout, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How are you holding up?
Augusta...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Now you've seen it. {Male=His;Female=Her} tiny little Echo. Silencing the Dark Tide with such ease... Resonance power. Such might. Such perfection.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Confined to this frail human form, you will achieve nothing.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You nearly lost everything... As you once did.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta... do not resist the "Gift of Divinity." Follow our guidance. Return to <te href=750016>Murmurstown</te>...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To your home...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If, and I say if... Septimont's fate has already been decided.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you continue to fight...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A ruler assumes their place... by accomplishing the impossible for their subjects.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It isn't safe here. I'll lead a team and escort everyone to a temporary camp not far from here. But before that, I must ensure no one is left behind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You go on ahead, {PlayerName}. I am entrusting Iuno to your care.

Chapters.Title: Head to the temporary camp

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How are you feeling? Do you want to rest a bit?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I appreciate your concern, but I'm not as fragile as you think... This road is nothing I can't handle...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You arrive at the camp and attend to Iuno, who's weakened from using her Forte. You ask about the strange visions she saw after firing her Moon Arrow. She's surprised you saw the Dark Tide's "illusions," but quickly realizes it's because you carry an "unknowable fate." What you witnessed, she explains, was a glimpse of the future—the fall of Septimont.

To change that fate, Iuno gave up her ability to see fate to gain a Forte capable of resisting the Dark Tide. But using this power comes at a cost. It consumes her very existence. The humanoid you saw was the Dark Tide's incarnate, the False Sovereign, and their true target all along. She and Augusta had planned to use Tyrannos as bait to lure the Sovereign out and use her power to make it vulnerable to attack, but the plan failed.

Now, to recover from the toll of using her Forte, Iuno must remain at the camp. Before parting, she entrusts you with her Lunarum bracelet, sealed with her Resonance Energy, hoping it will help you and Augusta finish the hunt in her absence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can set me down here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on... Don't give me that concerned look of yours. It's nothing to worry about.

Options.PlotLineKey: You could stand to rest more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait. You have questions. Don't pretend you don't.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, spit it out. It's only a minor injury, I can manage.

Options.PlotLineKey: I saw you fall into the Dark Tide.
I saw the moment of Augusta's death.
I saw the destruction of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you've managed to "glimpse" that far? Or is there more?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh. Just how many more surprises do you have for me? But I suppose only you could manage something like that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grandmother Lillibet, the Head Priestess you met at the Temple, once spoke of the "unknowable void" that is your fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've yet to fully interpret what she meant by that, but one thing is clear. You are the most unique among us all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They were... as I once perceived through the Sacred Flames... The fate of Septimont...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just as you saw, the Dark Tide will bring destruction to Septimont, and... the death of Augusta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know whether Ragunna's predictions are actually true, but fate has given me no response but sorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though I would deny it to the end, as it is now... I cannot ignore it any longer. The Dark Tide is a force to be reckoned with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Its terror lies not in the illusions it shows, or the lies it spins. Rather, it uncovers the parts of us we hide the most carefully. The parts of ourselves we least wish to face.

Options.PlotLineKey: And if the fate you've glimpsed turns out to be false?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Never. My prophecies are never wrong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How I... loathe this feeling. This helplessness. To know everything, to see everything, and yet be powerless to change a thing...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since we've come this far, might as well share a secret with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Iuno you see before you can no longer see the threads of fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I gave up my ability to peer into fate in "exchange" for the Resonance power to resist the Dark Tide. Why? Because I refused to be fate's obedient puppet, bowing to its whims and letting it dictate my every step.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But in the end... despite all the sacrifice, we still couldn't escape its grasp...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The dark figure we faced in Asphodel Barrens was, in fact, an embodiment of the Dark Tide. We call it the "False Sovereign."

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unlike other Dark Tide creations, it can devour and reshape the scattered powers of its maker.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm unclear how things will unfold, but I'm certain it's the source of evil that will bring about the fall of Septimont, just as the prophecy foretold.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before this hunt, Augusta and I investigated such Dark Tide irregularities at the Sanguis Plateaus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We then formed a plan to take advantage of the Sovereign's nature, using the Corrosaurus as bait to lure out its imperfect form...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe this way, we can rewrite Septimont's tragedy before it even begins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But as you can see, we failed...

Options.PlotLineKey: Is there really no way to alter fate and the prophecy?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do not know...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fate doesn't lie. Perhaps death is the only choice we're given in the end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But knowing Augusta... I'm sure that fool would fight till the bitter end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is one thing... I'm not certain about. For reasons I can't explain, the fate shown to me by the Dark Tide feels different from what I remember.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is it exactly? Ugh...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A side effect of my Resonance power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide doesn't exactly show up in a stable form. My powers manifest its creations in exchange for a teensy piece of my "existence." That's the price to pay, I suppose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh. I admit it sounds a bit complicated. In short, just know that a little sleep will relieve these side effects.

Options.PlotLineKey: Understanding this situation will take time.
Until then, focus on resting and getting better.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A fair point. Once I've recovered my strength, sorting out these questions will be as simple as a flick of a finger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, by the way, take this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Lunarum bracelet containing a small portion of my Resonance power. It was passed down to me by my predecessor when I became a Priestess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's quite dear to me, you know, so be sure to take extra good care of it. And don't expect there will be a spare if you lose it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rely on it in my absence. Who knows, it may even help fill in for me and help you and Augusta in my place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, why would you say that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll only be taking a short nap! Don't you or Augusta even dare think about leaving me behind, is that clear?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tomas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have a bad feeling about this one…

Dialogues.Speaker: Tomas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just want one last sip of Heartpour. Not sure we'll make it back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tomas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What?! You got a bottle on you? Miracle. Didn't think I'd get to try it here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tomas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's it. Just like I remember.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tomas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. If we get out of this, next drink is on me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tomas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, it's you! The one who gave me the Heartpour.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tomas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Never imagined you were the destined Hero of Heroes…

Dialogues.Speaker: Tomas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now we're both back, it's time I kept my promise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tomas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on! Drinks are on me. Let's get wrecked!

Dialogues.Speaker: Annalisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno… I've heard tales about her hunts, but nothing like seeing her in action…

Dialogues.Speaker: Annalisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing serious for now…

Dialogues.Speaker: Annalisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But she went too far with her Forte…

Dialogues.Speaker: Annalisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should let her rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Annalisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think today changed a lot of minds about her.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I should see how things are with Augusta now.

Chapters.Title: Head to the main tent and find Augusta

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The situation we're currently facing is more dire than any I've come across. For the sake of Septimont, I must momentarily set aside my quest for power...

Options.PlotLineKey: (Ask about the events Iuno mentioned at Tetragon Temple.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My four expeditions to Manes Deep?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now may not be the best time to discuss past events, but if you insist...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It dates back to a High Tide four years ago... At the time, we were driven by the fury of the Dark Tide into the lower levels of the hunting grounds, the <te href=750017>Wastelands</te>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I had no intention of emulating the feats of the three Hero of Heroes in conquering Manes Deep. But with the Dark Tide's blockade, I had to lead repeated expeditions into those underground ruins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fortune, however, did not turn its back on us. In that dark and treacherous place, my companions and I managed to carve out a path to survival.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are those companions of yours also in this hunt?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Fate has its ways. Now, only I remain able to face the hunting grounds' trials.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Many of my companions fell to the corruption of the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those left barely overcame the Dark Tide's influence with the help of a plant unique to Manes Deep, <te href=750018>Mesona</te>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even so, they still suffered from the torment it caused and were forced to cut their time as Gladiators short.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Holmleaf Medal was granted to me by the former Ephor after the crisis.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A victory, yes, but one laced with pain. My companions should never have suffered the Dark Tide's disgrace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You contact Consultant Buling of the Black Shores. She reports that the Tethys System has detected the False Sovereign rapidly consuming nearby frequencies and growing stronger. Left unchecked, it could threaten the Earthrend Wedge and trigger a catastrophic collapse. To stop the Dark Tide's spread and intercept the Sovereign, you, Augusta, and the Gladiators set out for Murmurstown, the most frequency-rich area in the hunting grounds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ephor's Palace Attendant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Messages have been sent to the encampment and all sectors of the main island, and defenses are currently being deployed per your instructions, Your Excellency.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. Ensure timely reports on any new developments.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ephor's Palace Attendant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, Your Excellency.

Options.PlotLineKey: How are things playing out here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've made arrangements for the war effort. Strategically, we must always brace ourselves for the worst.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Communications with the Black Shores are also underway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Ephor's Palace has previously established a connection with a Consultant in the Rinascita region. We've reached an agreement granting the Black Shores permission to access Septimont's Resonance Nexus. They'll be able to monitor and collect data on the Dark Tide during the hunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In return, should any complications arise, the Black Shores are to fulfill their side of the agreement and provide us with the necessary technical support.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Consultant active in Rinascita?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right. Her name is Buling. An interesting young lady. Left quite an impression on me.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So it is her...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why don't you let me handle contacting the Black Shores, Augusta?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We... talk from time to time. It'll help make things smoother for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. I'll leave it to you then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, I think I got the whole picture now... Oh {PlayerName}, how do you keep ending up in messes like this? This is one tough cookie, all right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean...

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me tell you, the latest data we got from the Resonance Nexus isn't so pretty. Something's really off with the Dark Tide in that Sanguis place. I don't remember it being this crazy before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Normally, the Dark Tide getting all freaky during High Tide is whatever, right? But now, I don't know what happened, cuz it's... it's turning into a person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So listen up, I'll give you Tethys's rundown. That humanoid thing, that "Sovereign," is gobbling up frequencies like a maniac!

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's eating anything with energy. Dark Tide stuff, Tacet Discords, Echoes, you name it. Might even be saving other things for dessert.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Basically, the Sovereign isn't gonna attack Septimont or Ragunna anytime soon. It's too busy getting fat first. Once it's stuffed full of energy, it'll try and smash the Earthrend Wedge in one go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the Earthrender gone, POOF—all that Dark Tide under the hunting grounds will explode like a pimple. When that happens, it's game over for Rinascita. Even if you have three heads and six arms, it will be bye-bye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You recall what Iuno once shared with you—the plan she and Augusta devised to hunt down the Sovereign. Though that plan has since failed, you relay the details to Buling, backed by Augusta's permit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But smooth moves, team. Cutting through the clutter, I see what you're doing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Corrosaurus is just the bait to hook the big fish, isn't it? Your real plan is to stop the Sovereign before it fully forms, nip it in the bud.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Am I right, Boss?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are right on the mark.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heaven and earth are in harmony... That's my reading, so your plan shouldn't have fallen apart like that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But then again... smooth sailing isn't always a good thing either. Too much harmony invites trouble. Tethys did pick up a strange frequency midway through the hunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything was fine until that frequency came out of nowhere, and suddenly the Sovereign took form way ahead of schedule. Talk about flipping the table.

Options.PlotLineKey: Can you trace the frequency back to its source?

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Umm. Well. Let me get another reading... The Chi's all messed up, it's kind of hard to see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's like someone clouded the heavenly signs on purpose...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One way or another, we must find the Sovereign and stop it before it absorbs any more frequencies... This might be our only option for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right. Supernatural powers or not, the Sovereign can't escape good old Tethys. Lemme see... Yep, it's wandering in an area with a whole lot of other frequencies...

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like it's east of the Sanguis Plateaus. Yeah, that place has lots of dark energy. Bet many tough people died there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Murmurstown...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood. I will stop it in its tracks.

Options.PlotLineKey: If the Sovereign wants to destroy the Earthrender, I can't let that happen.
Under the oath of the hunt, I will fight alongside you to the very end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your Excellency.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With your permission, I wish to accompany you to Murmurstown.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know this request may seem bold, and I'm aware of the dangers ahead. But as a warrior of Septimont, I cannot simply stand by.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gladiators, we are united as defenders of Septimont's honor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do not claim the right to ask this of you, but in my heart, I believe everyone here has earned the glory we bear. Let our deeds today reflect that greatness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well said, young man. Gladiators of Septimont fear no challenge. When the storm approaches, can an eagle soaring in the skies remain content as a fledgling beneath another's wings?

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your Excellency, we will follow you anywhere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well. You have sworn your allegiance to Septimont with your resolve. Your bravery is witnessed not only by me, but by the fallen heroes lying in Capitoline Hill. They take pride in your courage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you wish to fight together, then so be it. I will afford your fervor its due respect.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come. Take up your blades—For Septimont. For the name of heroes eternal.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A wise choice, Augusta...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is time. Return to where you belong. Fabianum has long awaited your homecoming...

Chapters.Title: Ride the Wingray and head to Murmurstown

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once consumed by the Dark Tide, the ruins of Murmurstown still bear its scars. In the face of such destruction, the hunting party knows this hunt cannot fail. Avidius offers to lead a team to place Anchor Stones around the town's perimeter, sealing off any escape routes. Meanwhile, you and Augusta will enter the ruins and track the Sovereign's presence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Wastelands...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I never imagined that after four years, I would return to this place under such circumstances...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cowardly Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did this place get like this…?

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is where the Dark Tide started sixteen years ago. The fact that this empty shell still stands is a miracle in itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cowardly Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Does this mean... if we fail to stop the Dark Tide, Septimont too will...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Warriors, do not let fear stand in our way. The untarnished glory of Septimont stands behind us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The devastation that befell Murmurstown sixteen years ago will never be repeated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because now, we are here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sovereign won't make things easy for us. Any rash action before we can confirm its location and status would be unwise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your command is our duty, Your Excellency. We will deploy Anchor Stones around Murmurstown, and I'll personally see that the perimeter stays undisturbed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. This will trap Sovereign inside the town.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. Proceed as planned, Avidius.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, then. It falls to us to track down the Sovereign's whereabouts, {PlayerName}. Time is short, so we'll need to split up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Keep your guard up. Those <te href=750019>Hollow Figures</te>, do not be fooled by their stillness. Those are just the shell. And watch for their songs of corruption.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They were once our own—brave Gladiators, loyal citizens of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide not only twisted their minds, it also raised their corpses and turned them into mindless puppets. Not even death could set them free.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mark my words, it will pay for this malevolence.

Chapters.Title: Explore Murmurstown
Enter the Sonoro Sphere at the Waystone

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are we still in Murmurstown?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... there are small differences.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is Murmurstown, only from the past...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was once called Fabianum—the town of Gladiators, visited by Fabius, the Hero of Heroes. But the Dark Tide claimed it in the end, leaving behind a scar Septimont will never forget.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta, look over there.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are those... lingering frequencies from the past?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's follow them. It might lead us to more answers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Inside the Sonoro Sphere, you see Murmurstown as it once was before the Dark Tide, then known as Fabianum. The glowing frequency of the unyielding Gladiator's spirit appears, guiding you deeper into the Sonoro.

Chapters.Title: Enter the Sonoro Sphere at the Waystone
Follow the "light spark"  and explore the Sonoro

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't see you by the Oak Hollow today…
You promised we'd go explore Manes Deep together. Don't tell me you got roped into errands again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh... Sorry...

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Otho got hurt, and Uncle Filo's short on help at the shop, so… I volunteered... but I lost track of time…
Alright, alright...
But isn't it odd how people always come asking you for help? We're children, after all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I don't know.
Hmm... me neither...
...I guess it is High Tide season. Uncle Filo must be busy at his forge. Even Ma and Pa are busy preparing for the hunt.
Sigh… If only we could find our way to Manes Deep. Maybe we'd hear the Hero of Heroes' whispers and gain a mighty Resonance, just like in Grandma Rosa's stories.
If I were strong enough to join the hunt, maybe Ma and Pa wouldn't have to work themselves to the bone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're strong to me, Angel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sometimes I wish I could be as strong as you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I… I don't think I've ever had your gifts. Father always said, "You swing a sword fine enough, but your Resonance ability is... average at best. Not Gladiator material."

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Average? I don't believe that for a second. Come on, let me see your hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your Tacet Mark's there, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey... why are you hesitating? Show me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tsk, I'm going to Uncle Filo! This is obviously from his forge burning you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not his fault. I was just being careless...

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I asked to borrow some of his old rusty swords… and if I worked fast enough, he'd let me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grandma Rosa said you need "two lives" to reach Manes Deep. We don't have our swords yet. We're missing a "life." So I thought if I could get us some...

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not this again... You really can be a handful sometimes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Sixteen years ago. Right before the Dark Tide hit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, there's that floating thing again!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think it's trying to lead the way for us this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should follow it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find two Phantoms of the past replaying a memory. A girl named Angel scolds her friend for missing their promised trip to Manes Deep. The girl had been called to help at the blacksmith as the High Tide approached, even bearing burns from the forge trying to earn the swords needed for their trip. After all, "two lives" are needed to reach Manes Deep: one's own, and a blade. Faced with this quiet act of sacrifice, Angel is left speechless.

Chapters.Title: Follow the "light spark"  and explore the Sonoro

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It's hovering by those Phantoms.

Dialogues.Speaker: Crying Child
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Crying)

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There you are. I was looking everywhere for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, take some of these candies. Grandma Rosa gave them to us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Crying Child
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm...

Dialogues.Speaker: Crying Child
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey... do you think what Grandma Rosa said about Manes Deep is... real?

Dialogues.Speaker: Crying Child
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like… if I really heard the Hero of Heroes' whispers in Oak Hollow… do you think I could ask them to fix my brother's leg?

Dialogues.Speaker: Crying Child
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With a Resonance Ability that powerful, maybe he could get better, just like how he was...

Dialogues.Speaker: Crying Child
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...The grown-ups keep saying how awful this Dark Tide will be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Crying Child
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And my brother's leg... it won't heal. They said he'll never be a Gladiator now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that case... why not try your luck in Oak Hollow?

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can take my sword. Just make sure to bring it back to Uncle Filo later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Crying Child
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... aren't you coming too? There's no extra sword...

Dialogues.Speaker: Crying Child
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can't reach Manes Deep without your sword...

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay. I'll wait till next time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll find a way to get more swords so everyone can have one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hm? That little girl… does her voice sound familiar to you, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I feel like I've heard it somewhere before…

Options.PlotLineKey: Looks like there's a garden behind that building.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've got no other leads for now. Let's check it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
