Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A second memory unfolds. A girl comforts a crying boy whose brother was gravely wounded by the Dark Tide. The boy hopes to journey to Oak Hollow to find a path to Manes Deep, believing the legendary Whispers of past Heroes of Heroes there may hold the key to healing him. The girl silently hands him her borrowed sword, giving up her own chance to enter Manes Deep without regret.

Chapters.Title: Enter the Sonoro Sphere at the Waystone
Follow the "light spark"  and explore the Sonoro

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ████ were there ████! You wouldn't believe ████████

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh... it's cutting out. I can't hear what it's saying.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, that floating thing… seems like it's distracted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something's messing with it, but I can't see what. Feels like... I dunno, like there's an invisible wall cutting us off...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another Waystone. That can't be just a coincidence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It led us into the Sonoro... maybe it can lead us out.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're saying we should use it to leave the Sonoro...  and that whatever's messing with us might be coming from outside?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could be. It's worth trying.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More Phantoms of the past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, {PlayerName}, look over there, I see it!

Chapters.Title: Exit the Sonoro Sphere at the Waystone

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can't believe we actually made it out.

Chapters.Title: Investigate the abnormal area

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More Hollow Figures! So it really was them!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, leave them to me.

Chapters.Title: Exit the Sonoro Sphere at the Waystone
Exit the Sonoro Sphere at the Waystone
Shatter the Hollow Figures and free the "light spark"

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This should work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, team! Let's head back to the Sonoro!

Chapters.Title: Enter the Sonoro Sphere at the Waystone
Inspect the Phantoms again

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wish you were there, Angel! You wouldn't believe what happened. Phew, haha…

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I only ran a few laps with Enric, and guess what? He got so dizzy he tripped over his own feet, and smack! Chipped a tooth! Haha!

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold still. I'm trying to get the salve on. Look at you, black and blue and still grinning like a goat...

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, out with it. What'd you do to that thick-skulled Enric this time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're hurt pretty bad… Guess that means no Oak Hollow then. Not that it matters, I bet there's still nothing there but moss and mud.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …He was picking on the little ones. I couldn't just stand there and watch.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I told him, "Learn how to kneel before asking others to."

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And that's when he snapped...

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Couldn't beat him, but still threw down... That's just like you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way... I heard things aren't going too well at the Hunter's Den. Ma and Pa haven't come home in days, and the whole town is holding its breath.

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We ought to return those swords to Uncle Filo too…

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, Manes Deep will have to wait a bit longer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay. We'll go after the High Tide passes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? Thought you'd be storming around about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What if the whispers are real? And the great Resonance ability too. Maybe that's how we end up Heroes of Heroes, both of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Hero of Heroes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's still what you want, isn’t it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is… I think everyone in the village wants that. The Priestesses say once you become a Hero of Heroes, even the Dark Tide won't scare you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Makes sense. Not just any hero, but the Hero of Heroes… Feels a long way off for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Sounding Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mm… But maybe it also means making people smile. If the Dark Tide disappeared, everyone would be happy, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That sounds too easy to be true...

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if that's all it takes, you've done it already, Augusta. But skip Enric, making a louse like him grin shouldn't count!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the third memory, Angel tends to her friend's injuries sustained while standing up to a bully, causing her to miss yet another chance to visit Oak Hollow. Angel worries that the coming High Tide feels different and might make future visits to Manes Deep impossible. Still, she clings to her dream of hearing the legendary Whispers and becoming a Hero of Heroes. Her friend, however, believes a true hero is someone who brings hope to others. As the Reverberation of the past fades, you realize the quiet girl beside Angel was Augusta all along.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems like our little flutterbug has finally calmed down, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go look at the Phantoms over there.

Chapters.Title: Enter the Sonoro Sphere at the Waystone
Inspect the Phantoms again

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta confirms that the Reverberations are memories from her childhood. You come to learn that the fall of Murmurstown, then called Fabianum, was not only caused by the Dark Tide, but also by corruption within Septimont's leadership. With no time to waste, you and Augusta press deeper into the Sonoro Sphere to continue the hunt for the pure Dark Tide frequency.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, guess there's no denying it now. I thought I might keep my foolishness as a child from you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Murmurstown... I mean, Fabianum, is your hometown?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. It's been a long time. I never imagined I'd see my past like this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... I'm curious...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: About Manes Deep and the Oak Hollow?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...The name Fabianum once stood for glory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As Septimont's frontline against the Dark Tide, it held the honor of receiving legends like Fabius, Atilius, and Valeria.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps that's why Hero of Heroes tales always lingered here. The most popular one was the tale of a great journey to Manes Deep, the ruins of an ancient civilization.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was said that if you brought "two lives"—yourself and your sword—you'd be granted entry. And within, you'd hear the unceasing whispers of the legendary heroes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whispers... they say, capable of awakening a Resonance ability as mighty as the heroes' own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the Oak Hollow said to lead to Manes Deep... just children's tales. No one ever knew if it was real.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Fabianum never found its Hero of Heroes... Ever since then, the name was lost, replaced by Murmurstown, a scar that Septimont refuses to face...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The whole town held out until the very end, yet no aid ever came from the City of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Later, I heard from the senior Gladiators that on the very morning Fabianum fell, most of the Senate lords were still sound asleep in their warm beds...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh... it wasn't the Dark Tide that doomed my hometown, but those in power who were blinded by greed and failed to act.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forgive me. I let my emotions get the better of me.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's okay. I feel like I've discovered another side of you.
It's okay. I can tell you've always been very sincere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Then perhaps I should spend more time with you. Like Iuno once did.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why did the Sonoro reveal all this to us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe it's helping us find that... um, pure Dark Tide frequency? The scent does feel clearer now, less muddled.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or maybe... it meant to show us something more.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Tell Augusta about the Unyielding Gladiator's Spirit.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A soul who endured the Dark Tide's corruption... and still fights to speak the truth?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... his spirit deserves to be remembered. I will go to witness that truth with my own eyes.

Chapters.Title: Follow the "light spark"  and explore the Sonoro

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those Phantoms up ahead... looks like they've lost control.

Chapters.Title: Enter the Sonoro Sphere at the Waystone
Follow the "light spark"  and explore the Sonoro
Inspect the source of the noise

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone's been...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Angel, what do we—

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Angel? What happened? You're bleeding...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Stay with me. I'll get you out of here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No… There are monsters everywhere… You won't make it, not with me…

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Just leave me and...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? It stopped again... I don't hear anything. Did it end just like that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember being trapped inside with Angel, surrounded by Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it hadn't been for a brave Gladiator stepping in and fighting them off with his life... none of us would have made it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps we recreate what happened back then to stir the Phantoms. We defeat the Tacet Discords, just as that Gladiator did.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But they're just Phantoms. How do you fight something that's not even real?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Again, we'll fight them outside the Sonoro.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, right, the Waystone!

Chapters.Title: Exit the Sonoro Sphere at the Waystone

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tacet Discords! Over there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time to work.

Chapters.Title: Defeat the Tacet Discords

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's return to the Sonoro. There's likely something new to see there.

Chapters.Title: Enter the Sonoro Sphere at the Waystone
Inspect the Phantoms again

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, this is it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, haha... at least I'm not on my knees...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...He's... not breathing...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Thank you...

Chapters.Title: Follow after the Phantoms

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta... are you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you going to face it alone?

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No! Don't! Just come with me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I promised I'd get you out of here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, Augusta! Augusta...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: H-Hey, you! Evil monster!

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Why don't you fight me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I'm not scared! Come on, I'm wide open.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't look away! I'm not someone you can ignore!

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No—

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not there! Look at me! I said LOOK AT ME!

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Angel... Angel!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide answers only to strength. Those without it are doomed to be forsaken...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta, my brave yet fragile child… Your strength is far too feeble, unfit to sate the hunger of the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You long to become a hero, to reign by might… But tell me... can the throne of glory be claimed by one so weak?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Deeper within the Sonoro Sphere, the guiding "light" leads you to Oak Hollow, where Phantoms replay a tragic scene. Angel lies wounded and paralyzed. Young Augusta hides her in the tree's hollow while confronting the Dark Tide alone. But the Dark Tide floods the hollow, ignoring Augusta entirely. That is the first time Augusta begins to hear the Whispers. They accuse her of weakness and deny her dream of becoming a Hero of Heroes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta opens up and confides in you about her journey to become Ephor and how her vow to protect Septimont never wavered. Augusta surprises you by saying you might be more fitting as the prophesied Hero of Heroes. You counter that a true ruler doesn't need prophecy to lead. Suddenly, you feel a shift within Oak Hollow. The pure Dark Tide frequency you've been hunting might be hiding inside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide paid me no mind. Its target was always Angel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the whispers… they were real, but not as the legends promised. What I heard were words of cruelty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: None of it matters now. Those things belong to the past...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was a reckless child, a hatchling flailing with a sword I could barely hold.

Options.PlotLineKey: But you've grown stronger ever since.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: True... though, back then, I didn't really have a choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is Septimont, a place where ideals bow to strength.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As a child, I had no desire for power. But in the City of Septimont, if I wished to rise beyond my origin and silence arrogance dressed in fame and fortune, I had no other path.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, my strength speaks in my stead, and my blade cuts down every slander.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All but prejudice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know well what those parasites in the Senate are plotting. Draped in the Temple's name, they manipulate public opinion to secure themselves a place on Capitoline Hill.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But their absurd schemes betray only fear—

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Too afraid to face me, they skulk in the shadows, hoping empty prophecies might bring me to my knees.

Options.PlotLineKey: So... you don't believe in the prophecies?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not about belief. It's about not fearing them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide still haunts Septimont. People live in terror of losing their homeland again, and so they cling to the hope of a Hero of Heroes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As Septimont's Ephor, I must stay strong and answer their call.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A ruler has no right to falter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If my Resonance ability raises doubts about my right to rule, then let the true Hero of Heroes step forth and challenge me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And if none appear... I will decide whether this title is worthy of the weight of a ruler's glory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One of the prophecies speaks of a Hero of Heroes wielding extraordinary power, rising from the dark tides. As I see it, you, {PlayerName}, fit that image well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should it be you... I would gladly accept your challenge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A person of immense strength is either a nemesis or a kindred spirit, both of which are intriguing to me and my blade.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me? Honestly, the thought never crossed my mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From what I've seen, being a true ruler isn't about having immense strength, whether that's a powerful Resonance ability or sheer might.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've met people from Huanglong to Rinascita who live with real integrity. Their skills and backgrounds were all different, and... none of them were perfect.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But what defines them isn't strength or anything that can be measured. It's the spirit they were born with. Resilient. Unyielding. That can't be stolen.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Believe me, Augusta, I see that same spirit in you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno once said something similar to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...What happened within the Oak Hollow remains a mystery. All I know is, when I found her, her Resonance ability had grown immensely, so powerful that even the Dark Tide could not withstand it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But she failed to control it. I could do nothing but watch as she transformed into... something no longer human. After that, I never saw her again.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Dark Tide occurrence sixteen years ago... Its frequency must have been more stable than it is now.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe this is the truth the Gladiator's spirit is trying to share...

Chapters.Title: Enter Oak Hollow
Inspect the Phantom in Oak Hollow

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Angel!

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Y-you defeated the Dark Tide? That's... incredible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And your wounds... they're gone. Thank goodness! Did the whispers give you their power?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Angel, are you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Angel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Run... RUN!!!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the words fade, the Phantom carrying the Reverberation of the past dissolves. A swirling vortex of energy lingers where "Angel" vanished.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sniff...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's that smell, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The truth... The Dark Tide... and the pure frequency...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you certain that's what we're looking for, {PlayerName}? How could Angel be carrying the Dark Tide's frequency...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If anyone can sniff out the truth, it's Abby. But just to be sure, I'll send the data to Buling once we're out of here.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores will give us an answer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More Phantoms appear inside Oak Hollow. Young Augusta rushes to Angel's side, believing the Whispers may have granted her the power to fend off the Dark Tide. But something is wrong. Just before her Phantom vanishes into a swirling vortex of pure Dark Tide frequency, Angel cries out, urging Augusta to flee. Stunned, you and Augusta collect the frequency and prepare to send it to Buling for analysis at the Black Shores.

Chapters.Title: Obtain the pure Dark Tide frequency
Exit the Sonoro Sphere at the Waystone

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After leaving the Sonoro, you return to Murmurstown and send the pure Dark Tide frequency to Buling.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's all done, Boss! Tethys ran the data through a couple filters, and we've zeroed in on one spot in the hunting grounds. Pretty sure that's where the Sovereign's been hiding.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sending you the coordinates now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …So the frequency we collected really was from the Dark Tide?

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, looks that way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But this one's... weird. It feels still, like undisturbed water. Quiet, like it's asleep. Basically, nothing is disturbing it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I had to describe it, I'd say... it's like a Reverberation left behind when the Dark Tide slams head-first into someone's Forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On its own, it's not as dangerous as the Dark Tide, but if it got mixed with another Forte and stirred up… well, who knows what kind of explosion of power that could cause...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Angel... and the Dark Tide...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Understood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go, {PlayerName}. Time to meet our prey.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll tell the others to meet at that location.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Outside Murmurstown, Avidius leads the Gladiators in setting up Anchor Stones. Senator Falco criticizes his lack of leadership during the Corrosaurus hunt, claiming Avidius has failed to meet the expectations of a Hero of Heroes. After a heated argument, Falco is suddenly possessed by the Dark Tide, attacking the others.

After restoring order, Avidius sets out alone for Manes Deep to find Mesona, an herb that can help reverse the Dark Tide's corruption. But when he reaches Oak Hollow, the entrance he remembers is an impenetrable wall. Thinking it to be a Dark Tide illusion, he uses his Resonance ability to break through. The attempt fails, inadvertently awakening a sleeping power.

Still reeling, Avidius receives a message from Augusta. The False Sovereign has been located, and it's time to regroup.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please hurry, everyone. The Anchor Stone must be in place before the Sovereign's hunt begins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shrewd Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such devotion. Forgive me, but you seem to forget your place, Avidius.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that so? Perhaps you'd like to remind me, my lord.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shrewd Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph. You must be aware of your rather underwhelming performance during the Tyrannos hunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shrewd Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Senate's patience is not boundless. It's reserved for those who deserve it. Unless you can present a triumph to match your exploits in Manes Deep, we'll have no choice but to... reconsider your candidacy as Septimont's next ruler.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shrewd Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wake up, Avidius. Isn't Murmurstown the very place where your glory began? That, Avidius, is your true arena.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shrewd Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet here you are, entangled in Augusta's petty concerns when you could be seizing something far greater.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How very amusing, Lord Falco.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You seek a ruler strong enough to lead, yet pliable enough to be led. You'd have better luck finding a needle in the sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Were I in your position, I'd keep my mouth shut. If Septimont falls, so will your ambitions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And allow me to remind you: I entered Manes Deep because I had no other choice, and my duty as a Gladiator demanded it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The blood I shed, the blade I wielded—these were proof of loyalty, not entertainment for the lords. If that's how you see it... then perhaps it is I who should reconsider this alliance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shrewd Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How dare you—

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, got some grit, eh? Haven't let ambition cloud your mind. I like that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Falco? What are you—

Dialogues.Speaker: Shrewd Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Groans in pain*

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...He may be under the Hollow Figures' influence. Judging by his behavior, the Dark Tide has already corrupted his mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Anchor Stone is nearly in place. Sir Hercle, would you please take Lord Falco to rest?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This isn't far from the entrance to Manes Deep. I remember finding Mesona nearby. It's an herb that helped my companions and me resist the Dark Tide's corruption.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Lord Falco has paid for his pride. But as a former hero, he deserves a death free from the Dark Tide's torment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will do what I can to help...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sir Hercle, please look after him. I'll bring the herb back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I promise it won't take long. Don't worry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright. You go do what you believe is right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...How could it be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... It must be the Dark Tide's illusion...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This wall... No, it can't be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My fellow Gladiators! Our prey has finally revealed itself. Move to the marked coordinates. It's time to hunt.

Chapters.Title: Follow the coordinates and pursue the False Sovereign

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the pure Dark Tide frequency you recovered, the Black Shores pinpoints the False Sovereign's location. You and Augusta head to the coordinates. Using Iuno's Lunarum bracelet, you force the Sovereign to show itself. The Gladiators, responding to Augusta's call, begin to gather for the final confrontation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the place! The smell's getting stronger!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No traces of the Sovereign... It must be hiding again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We must force it to show itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps this could work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Over there.

Chapters.Title: Defeat the False Sovereign

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... I-I can't take it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Y-yeah...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But my belly... Ugh... it's full...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm... so tired...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Faithless one... The strength you refused shall now become the blade that strikes you down...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To spurn a divine gift is to invite consequence, and Divinity offers mercy but once...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno, I...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, it can't end like this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All able units! Split into two teams! One will escort the wounded back to base, while the other prepares supplies and maintains position!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The Sovereign's power grows exponentially after absorbing the pure Dark Tide frequencies sealed within Oak Hollow and the surrounding frequencies of deceased souls in Murmurstown. It now seeks to uproot the Earthrend Wedge and unleash the full force of the Dark Tide being suppressed beneath the Sanguis Plateaus. Rinascita teeters on the brink of catastrophe.

However, Buling identifies a weakness in the Sovereign. Iuno proposes a plan to use the Anchor Stones to disrupt its internal frequency and reclaim control of the Wedge. To buy time for the plan to work, Iuno offers to put her own existence on the line by using her Forte to keep the Sovereign exposed.

As the final battle approaches, she tells you that your "unknowable fate" might be the key to overcoming the crisis. She implores that you stand with Augusta until the very end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Boss, what's going on?! I got a bad feeling just now, and Tethys won't stop pumping out alerts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aha… figures. That area you're in has buried many warriors. For the Sovereign, it's like having a free buffet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And sure enough, you blink and it's already swallowed up all the surrounding frequencies. Now it's a real nightmare.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That said…

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The situation's bad, no doubt. But we're not out of moves yet... The Dark Tide isn't spreading at full speed. If we act fast and find the Sovereign's weak spot, we might just pull a miracle for Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's see… Fire under earth, light be blocked... That's it. Tethys is showing messy internal frequencies and unstable structures. Looks like after stuffing itself with all those frequencies, the Sovereign's completely scrambled inside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we can stir up the mess in its gut, even with something small, we might just throw him off balance. And then, maybe we can wrest the Earthrend Wedge back and readjust it to—

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Terrible timing... Is there any other way to reach her?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the Dark Tide...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The entire frequency range is under its control. In other words, we're completely cut off here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tch, how vexing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide's inside...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we feed that monster something else…

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right, the Anchor Stone!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're suggesting... we let the Sovereign absorb the Anchor Stone? If it works, it could suppress it from the inside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very sharp. But before we act, there are two things we need to prepare.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: First, we'll need to get the Sovereign to open up and swallow the Anchor Stone like a good boy. That will be on you and Augusta, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Second, the Dark Tide itself must be stabilized to keep the Sovereign nice and solid. My job, naturally. No one else is fit for the task.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sovereign is far stronger than before, and you've only just recovered. There's no way you can take on that much Resonance energy at once.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not made of glass, Augusta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am Iuno, the most gifted Priestess Septimont has seen in generations. If anyone can hold back the Dark Tide, it's me. And I'm not going to fall on you that easily.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, the Sacred Flames already showed me my end. In the warmth of spring, surrounded by white flowers, with gentle eyes watching over me. But that day is still far from today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At worst, I'll just need more time to recover. Everything's going to be alright. I promise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then it's settled. I'll let you prepare. Just give me a signal when you're near the Earthrender.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I won't be able to hold the Sovereign's form for long, so make the most of that window.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you forget anything, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Useful, isn't it? Keep it close. No matter where you go, a part of me goes with you, got it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since I've given you a tool so practical, I'll ask something in return. Just one thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Promise me you'll stay by Augusta's side, and face whatever destiny sets upon you. Together. This isn't a command or a suggestion. It's... a personal request.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only you can do this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think I understand what the "unknowable void" in your fate really means.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not nothingness, {PlayerName}. All along, it's represented a future that can't be defined by anything but your own will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As long as that void exists, you control your story. Your existence is the meaning itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So please, support Augusta with everything you have. I've seen how much she trusts you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So trust her in return. No matter what happens, you are not to doubt her in the slightest.

Options.PlotLineKey: Augusta and I already agreed to walk this path till the very end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the spirit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, you two. Stop standing around and get moving.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The sooner you settle this, the sooner I get to leave this boring place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno, one last question.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For someone without an unwritten fate... is it true they can never break free, no matter how hard they struggle?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... don't know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's alright.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, Augusta!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been thinking... our final fate might already be written, but how we walk that path is up to us. We, as humans, are meant to carve our own way forward!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we can't rewrite fate, then we chase it! Outpace it! Then, when we catch up, we'll smack it right in the face!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't forget what you once said: "A ruler assumes their place by accomplishing the impossible for their subjects."

Chapters.Title: Head to Earthrend Wedge with the Anchor Stone

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The journey ahead allows no retreat. Are you ready?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You hand the Anchor Stone to Augusta, who slashes it into pieces.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why did you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Buling mentioned even something small could have a great influence. The smaller, the more unnoticed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come, {PlayerName}. Stand with me to face our reckoning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let this small thing pry open the cracks in fate's door.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oak Hollow... I saw it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Manes Deep... It doesn't exist...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Is it... because of me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My memories... N-no...

Chapters.Title: Defeat the Tacet Discords and pass through Murmurstown
Defeat the Tacet Discords and pass through Murmurstown
Defeat the Tacet Discords and pass through Murmurstown
Defeat the Tacet Discords and pass through Murmurstown

Defeat the Tacet Discords and pass through Murmurstown

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go chase your fate... Augusta...

Chapters.Title: Head to the Earthrend Wedge

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you near the Earthrend Wedge, Augusta reveals that the Whispers have haunted her since the Dark Tide sixteen years ago, constantly trying to influence her choices and actions. But before you can process the revelation, she suddenly raises her sword and attacks you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing… Just something on my mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you still remember what the whispers told me sixteen years ago?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The Dark Tide answers only to strength. Those without it are doomed to be forsaken..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now I think of it, it is rather interesting...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never told anyone this before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But ever since the Dark Tide decided to "forsake" me, those broken whispers have never left.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They echoed in every battle, telling me when to dodge, when to strike. But with each opponent that fell, the whispers began to fade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until I became the Ephor...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...That's when they returned. Louder, never giving me a single moment of peace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I tried to shut them out, but every time I strayed from their guidance, fate would strike me down in the cruelest of ways.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought I was the master of my fate, but the truth is... they always knew the path better than I ever could.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...The old prophecy about Ragunna that they once whispered to me has come true.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, it is time for me to put their power to the test.

Chapters.Title: Confront Augusta

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (What exactly do you want to do, Augusta...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Give everything, {PlayerName}. I've realized this is the duty I must fulfill.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, that's it. Show me your strength.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The one to stand beside me for the throne is you. And only you.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Brazen faithless one!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Receive the judgment of the heavens

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The sacred crucible shall reshape your soul

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fool. I already said Ragunna's "Divinity" didn't get a seat on the ship

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is your end... Augusta...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh... but we're not done just yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Insolent heretic...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If this is what you want...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We shall grant you an endless feast of despair...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato's Spirit
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My sword… where's my sword…

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cato...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What haunts you, my teacher?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato's Spirit
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A hero shouldn't fall to the Dark Tide…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato's Spirit
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need my sword... to fight back...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, take it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take it, and fight for what you believe in.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pointless empathy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Resentful Spirit
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That medal... I deserve it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Pleading Spirit
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, I'm begging you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Spirit
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That should have been mine…

Dialogues.Speaker: Desperate Spirit
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's gone, my golden crown...

Dialogues.Speaker: Desperate Spirit
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Give it to me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tormented Spirit
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your blood... Your flesh...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A loser left with nothing... dimmed like a speck of dust...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The throne of glory will never be claimed by the weak.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "A loser left with nothing"... How wrong you are...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People follow the sun, for it never fails to light their way...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is how I rule

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll show you—

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With my own fist!

Chapters.Title: Defeat the False Sovereign

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We meet again, my friend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems my will won't let me miss a chance to fight side by side with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come, {PlayerName}. I've been waiting for this moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, so it's finally come to this? Good. This is how a true battle should be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, fight by my side—

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This time, the blade of victory shall pierce the Hollow Sovereign's heart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Spirits lost to the Dark Tide, I hear your cries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Join me in battle!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let that false Divinity witness what true heroes are, and what it means to wield unshakable power!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May applause greet you, heroes of Septimont.

Chapters.Title: Talk to Augusta

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Together with Augusta and the souls of fallen heroes, you defeat the False Sovereign and reclaim control over the Earthrend Wedge. The threat of the Dark Tide is finally quelled.

With the hunt officially over, you stand beside Augusta and exchange your thoughts. Before you lies the Wedge, and within it, the Relic Sentinel Imperator left for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A hard-won battle... wasn't it?

Options.PlotLineKey: And yet, victory still chose our side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's all thanks to you, {PlayerName}—Septimont's Hero of Heroes.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that case… I could say the same to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the prophecy goes, "The Hero of Heroes wielding extraordinary power, rising from the dark tides." As I see it, you, Augusta, fit that image well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Extraordinary power? That's a bit much. I know my limits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But… I do think I've earned that title, and it's one we could share together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, the Temple never said there could only be one Hero of Heroes.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What really happened to you in the Dark Tide? I thought you might've...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, it wasn't a pleasant experience. But in a strange way… it was refreshing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you want to hear the full story, I'll tell you another time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But, back inside the Dark Tide, I think the lost frequencies were always guiding me, shaping who I was becoming.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even trapped in that abyss of despair, those fallen heroes never gave up. They lit a faint, warm light in the dark for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you, along with everyone who stood by me… without you, we couldn't have won this battle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps the title of "ruler" is too narrow and too hollow to define the true spirit of humankind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A civilization's glory is forged by generations of brave souls. It was never meant to be one person's medal of honor.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to ask you something.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why did you ask me to join the hunt?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because my warriors and I wanted to fight beside someone like you. That hasn't changed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But… I will be honest. Part of it was because of your "unwritten fate."

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd been preparing for this hunt for a long time. At first, all we had were a few vague glimpses from the Priestesses and a handful of prophetic murals. No one knew when or how the disaster would strike.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And then you showed up. You've surely seen the unfinished mural in the Temple. The blank wall and the unwritten fate...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I took a gamble, believing you were the key to this hunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I couldn't explain it back then, not when I wasn't certain myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But in the end, we realized what that "blank" represents. And my gamble paid off.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The one who deserves to be a Hero of Heroes, with power over the Earthrend Wedge...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for your trust, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: This is my response to your trust.
And the promise I swore to keep.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, it's time for me to honor my promise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the end of our journey... the Earthrend Wedge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It hasn't been quite what I expected, but I'm very glad we made it this far together.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imperator...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go. I'll wait for you here.

Chapters.Title: Retrieve Imperator's Relic before heading to the Earthrend Wedge

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...A discoid.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This warmth... I feel you, Imperator...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd better get back.

Chapters.Title: Talk to Augusta

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You recover Imperator's Relic, but the mysterious discoid appears to be locked. To unlock its secrets and end the threat of the Dark Tide once and for all, you decide to take it to the Black Shores and Cartethyia. But first, you and Augusta choose to savor this hard-won victory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you find what you seek?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A discoid? Looks like... a compass?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The structure's odd... There might be a hidden compartment inside. Can you try opening it, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If this relic was left by the Sentinel, brute force won't get us anywhere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll need a different approach. Maybe a special key, a mechanism, or a password...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Any ideas?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores' records on the Sentinel may give us more clues.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More importantly, I need their data on the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Earthrender's holding back the Dark Tide for now, but we're not in the clear yet. Those sudden outbreaks and the way it's fixated on you… it's not just a coincidence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right. With the Black Shores' tech, we might be able to outwit our unseen enemy.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll contact them as soon as we're back.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's a friend of mine who… well, she knows a lot about Imperator. She might be able to help solve this mystery.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More importantly... her powers are unique. The Earthrender's holding back the Dark Tide for now, but those sudden outbreaks and the way it's fixated on you… it's not just a coincidence.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If anyone can put an end to the Dark Tide's threat in Septimont, it's her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sounds like someone worth meeting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do introduce me later. I'm curious what kind of person she is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But one thing I'm sure of, she must be a formidable opponent and a figure to be respected, like you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You two share a lot in common, actually. I think you'd get along.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll reach out to her once we're back. She wasn't able to travel before due to some unavoidable reasons, but now, I think the timing's right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright. Let's set all this aside and enjoy the victory we've earned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's probably a bonfire roaring at the encampment by now… {PlayerName}, it's time to return to those waiting for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We won this battle, but the war is far from over. The road ahead's still steeped in blood and thorns. But with you, and everyone who stood beside us, the banner of Septimont will never fall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the eternal sun as my witness, the name of hero belongs to you all.
It's been a while, Rinascita.
What prey do we hunt this time?
...The Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Somewhere in Rinascita, a mysterious woman walks alongside a Dark Tide creation, her gaze fixed silently on the distant horizon. She turns to the creature and reveals the purpose of her return to this land—to hunt the Threnodian.
